name: 2-pyridineacetamide
Reason: 2-Pyridineacetamide has a pyridine ring, which has a melting point of -41.6°C. The acetamide group has a melting point of 82.0°C. The pyridine ring has a more rigid structure than a benzene ring, which increases the melting point. The acetamide group has a carbonyl group and an amide group, which can form hydrogen bonds, increasing the melting point. The pyridine ring has a nitrogen atom, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, further increasing the melting point. The net effect is a melting point increase due to the pyridine ring, acetamide group, and hydrogen bonding.
